results.title: International youth year
results.creator_credit: Department of Youth, Sport and Recreation and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A discussion starter about problems and issues facing young people. Looks at cultural understanding and racism, technological change and consumerism, apprenticeship rights, single mothers, alcoholism and drug dependence, authority, nuclear disarmament, student participation, homelessness, disabled people and unemployment.

results.title: International Velvet
results.brief_description: The sequel to “National Velvet.” This is the moving story of Sarah (Tatum O’Neal) and her intense determination to win the Equestrian Three Day Event Gold Medal at the Olympic Games. Co-starring Christopher Plummer, Anthony Hopkins and Nanette Newman.

results.title: International ice patrol
results.creator_credit: Affiliated Film Producers and Henwar Rodakiewicz
results.brief_description: Shows how the US Coast Guard, operating under international agreements, patrols the North Atlantic shipping lanes in search of icebergs, and issues warnings to ships. Illustrates through a portrayal of the cutter Mendota’s search for Iceberg No. 39 in June 1947.

results.title: Internal tantrum
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: In Internal Tantrum, Palestine sits before the camera with a severe expression of concentration, his body tense and his fists tightly wound. He begins to slowly chant and sway, evoking a powerful sense of grief and pain. He writes that the tape provides ‘a reading, like on the Richter Scale, of a certain kind of emotional internal roller coaster or earthquake. I used only one tone so the deliverance of energy becomes directly articulated in the sound.’ This performance is a simple yet intense rendering of pain, and the desire to move that pain outward from the internal.

results.title: Intern: a long year
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, John Barnes, Michael Livesey and Robert Johnson
results.brief_description: The year a doctor spends as an intern may seem routine to someone not in the medical profession. But for an intern it is a kaliedoscopic experience: the cases once studied only in textbooks become living patients. It is a difficult year for most interns, including Dr Karen Mack, the subject of this film.

results.title: Intermezzo
results.creator_credit: Glyndebourne, BBC-TV, John Cox and David Buckan
results.brief_description: Intermezzo by Richard Strauss is an autobiographical opera based on the real life relationship between Richard Strauss and his wife Pauline using the characters Robert and Christine Storch. Set in the 1920s, the central plot involves an innocent flirtation by the lonely and bored Christine (Felicity Lott) with the charming, but penniless, Baron Lummer (Ian Caley) whilst her composer husband Robert (John Pringle) is away on an official visit to Vienna. However life becomes complicated when an unexpected letter is delivered to Christine, the contents of which lead her to suspect her husband of having an illicit affair. This is an opera of comedy and wit with a blend of talking and singing, told in 14 scenes with symphonic interludes. Costume and set designs are lavish and stylish and very art nouveau authentically recreating the era and atmosphere of the times. Features the London Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Gustav Kuhn and supporting cast including Elizabeth Gale in the role of Anna, the chambermaid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Glyndebourne, BBC-TV, John Cox and David Buckan

results.title: Intermezzo
results.creator_credit: David O Selznick Productions, David O. Selznick and Gregory Ratoff
results.brief_description: A tragic but moving love story starring Ingrid Bergmann and Leslie Howard. The great concert violonist Holger Brandt is attracted to Anita Hoffman although he is happily married. He soon finds his love for Anita overwhelming and leaves his wife to tour Europe with her. But he cannot leave his past and his family ties behind and Anita sensing his dilemma, leaves him although it breaks her heart. Eventually Holgar and his wife are reunited as they share a personal tragedy. Sentimental, ‘Intermezzo’ is a great romantic classic.
